name: Globally Trivial Cities 'B' Trivia Quiz | Geography | 15 Questions

questions.text: What was the former name of the ancient city of Babylon?
questions.explanation:
Babel.

	Babel, the old Hebrew name for the city of Babylon, with its hanging gardens, was one of the seven wonders of the ancient world, until it was sacked by the Persians in 538 BC!

questions.text: In which Asian country is the city of Barisal?
questions.explanation:
Bangladesh.

	Barisal is a city with nearly a third of a million people, situated on the Kirtan Khola River.

questions.text: What is the name of the capital city of Mali?
questions.explanation:
Bamako.

	Bamako, the major industrial centre of Mali, is situated on the Niger River.  Mali gained its independence from France in 1960 and in 1992 held its first democratic presidential elections.

questions.text: After whom was the capital city of Queensland, Australia, named?
questions.explanation:
Sir Thomas Brisbane.

	Australia's third largest city, Brisbane, was named after the then Governor of New South Wales, Sir Thomas Brisbane.

questions.text: Which of these places is the name of an industrial port city in Aruba?
questions.explanation:
Barcadera.

	Aruba is a tropical island in the Caribbean which is still part of the Netherlands.  The Dutch government is responsible for defence and foreign affairs in Aruba!

questions.text: Located in the south west of Western Australia, what is the name of this port city?
questions.explanation:
Bunbury.

	Named after its founder, Lieutenant Henry William St Pierre Bunbury, this city was gazetted in 1979 and is a major port for the wheat and timber industries in Western Australia.

questions.text: Which Central American country's capital city is Belmopan?
questions.explanation:
Belize.

	Formerly British Honduras, and located on the Caribbean, Belize has some of the most breath-takingingly beautiful diving sites in the world and some fantastic Mayan ruins!

questions.text: Which of the following is a city in South Korea?
questions.explanation:
Busan.

	Located in south east South Korea, the 14th Asian Games were held in the port city of Busan in 2002.  Bangor is a city in Wales and in Maine; Beauvais is a city in France; and, Buzau is a city in Romania.

questions.text: Which of the following is the capital of Slovakia?
questions.explanation:
Bratislava.

	Bratislava is the capital city of the Slovak Republic which became a separate entity in 1993 after peacefully separating itself from the Czechs (who then became the Czech Republic)!

questions.text: Where is the city of Bujumbura?
questions.explanation:
Burundi.

	Bujumbura is the capital city of the Republic of Burundi in central Africa.  Unfortunately, fighting between Hutu and Tutsi factions has resulted in the displacement of thousands of Burundians and they are now refugees.

questions.text: Which of the following cities in Afghanistan lies in an area hit by earthquakes in March, 2002?
questions.explanation:
Baghlan.

	Baghlan is the capital city of the Baghlan Province in Northern Afghanistan.  Bamiyan was were the "Great Buddhas" once were, they were destroyed by Taliban officials in 2001.  The lakes of Band-i-Amir are surrounded by pink cliffs and the ancient citadel of Bala Hissar is in Kabul.

questions.text: Which of the following is in the country of Burkino Faso?
questions.explanation:
Bobo-Dioulasso.

	Bobo-Dioulasso is home to the Bobo people and is about 300km south of the capital city of Burkina Faso.  Bata is in Equatorial Guinea; Berenice is in Egypt; and, Ben Macdhui is a mountain in Lesotho.

questions.text: Which of the following is a city in Sweden?
questions.explanation:
Borlange.

	Borlänge is a city in central Sweden, on the Dal River.  Barrow is in Alaska; Bergen is in Norway; and, Bydgoszcz is in Poland.

questions.text: In which Asian country is Bumthang?
questions.explanation:
Bhutan.

	Bumthang is in central Bhutan.

questions.text: In which country of the Americas is Boyuibe?
questions.explanation:
Bolivia.

	Boyuibe is in the south of the Republic of Bolivia.
